pages.text: There are lots of options for monster and animal processing for you! Read on for further information.
The Interactor will perform one of four duties, extremely useful for automation.

The modes for the Interactor are as follows:$(li)Break Mode will remove the block in front of the unit, using a tool within the machine. The result will be dropped into the world.$(li)Interact Mode will right-click the block in front of it. Any items added to the "inventory" after each operation will be expelled into the world after each right-click.

$(li)Place Mode will place a block in front of the unit, either randomly or orderly from the internal capacity.$(li)Attack Mode will hit entities in a small area in front of it, either with an empty fist or a weapon located in the internal capacity of the Interactor.

The Inert Mob Crystal will be used to configure the $(item)Powered Spawner.$()To obtain:$(li)Use a Smooth Stone with Gravel and Sand in the Purifier to get a $(item)Polished Rock.$()$(li)Alloy Smelt the Polished Rock and a Netherrite Scrap to get the crystal.

Next, you need to kill an entity with a $(item)Mystium Sword$() while the Inert Mob Crystal is in your inventory, and if you are lucky, the crystal will activate.$(p)$(3)The Mystium Sword's secondary ability needs to be activated! For more info, view the $(l:items/mystium_tools)Mystium Tools Page.$()
Place the Activated Mob Crystal in the Powered Spawner, add power, and it will start summoning mobs!

The Powered Spawner is compatible with the $(item)Additional Output Upgrade, $()which will allow it to spawn more mobs per operation!$(p)It is also compatible with the regular $(item)Speed Upgrade,$() which will make it spawn quicker.
